did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Beau Geste Press Ephemera,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Beau Geste Press Ephemera, M0702, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Beau Geste Press existed in England between 1971-1974. It was founded by Felipe Ehrenberg, David Mayor, Chris Welch, and Martha Hellion. It printed the works of visual poets, conceptualists, and neo-dadaists, many of whom were closely tied to the Fluxus movement. The press printed artist books using inexpensive materials, such as mimeograph machines, cheap paper, and staples. Consequently, many of the materials in the collection are rather fragile. In 1974 the Beau Geste Press merged with several similar presses to form BAAA, the Beau and Aloes Arc Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Editions of the press' serial publication, "Schmuck," contain works of several artists from a single country, such as Iceland, France, and Hungary.

did.unittitle: Accession 1994-094
Series 1: Artist books
[An Argentinian Male Teenager.] Club de Orientacion Juvenil et infantil. Artist book. Wrappers. Staple bound. Stamped "Archive Copy." c1973
Beau Geste Press. 1973-1974 catalogue with provision to keep adding sheets as you receive them. Mail order catalog of BGP publications with brief descriptions. Wrappers. 1973
Chadwick, Helen and Mayor, David. Door to Door. Edition of 250. Artist book. Wrappers. Signed in black pen: "happy christmas father, love David X." 1973
Coum. Transmissions. Untitled postcard. Self-published. Stamped "Archive copy." 1973

Ehrenberg, Yael. Things by Yael. Artist book. Wrappers. Staple bound. Edition of 60. Stamped "Archive copy." 1972

Mayor, David. Extra. Some words and visions by david mayor. DIS/ -series. Artist book. Wrappers. Copy 89/100. 1971

Nations, Opal L., interpreted by Felipe Ehrenberg. The Man Who Entered Pictures. Artist book. Wrappers. Copy 96/150. June/July 1972
Nations, Opal L., interpreted by Felipe Ehrenberg. The Man Who Entered Pictures. Artist book. Wood covers. 30 copies bound into wood covers, signed by Nations and Ehrenberg. June/July 1972
Sitting Dog & Co. (Manifesto Pamphlet). 1972
Sitting Dog & Co. (Manifesto Pamphlet.) 1972

did.unittitle: Artist unknown. In defence of memory. (Emancipation of a substitute) ,,Just a Free Zone Story - until this moment" Refill Time... Architecture. Balloon. Printed black on red rubber (a little dried out). n.d.

Ehrenberg, Felipe. -P-. Cardboard cigarette box hand-painted purple with a silver letter P containing 66 cards printed on 1 side w/letters A-Z and &. Stamped Archive Copy. Signed and numbered. 4/50. "a throw it yourself poetry kit." 1972
